comment._content: this is from a brief "war" preceding WWI photo would be in early October 1912 en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Italo-Turkish_War

comment.author: 73511718@N00
comment._content: This would most likely have been during the bombardment of Derna by Pisa and other Italian ships between October 15 and 18, 1912.

comment.author: 35072786@N08
comment._content: Thank you for your information about this photo.  It does appear to be related to the Italo-Turkish War.  We will update the source data and reload the description.

comment.author: 52889903@N03
comment._content: Is it possible that the four towers visible in the background are oil drills?

comment.author: 76016463@N00
comment._content: see also More on the Pisa and Italian Pisa class armored battle cruisers:www.cityofart.net/bship/rn_garibaldi.html (scroll down) Pisa served in WWI, then was reclassified as a coastal battleship in 1921 and used as a training ship until being scrapped in 1937. en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pisa_class_armored_cruiser Her sister ship, sold to Greece as the Georgios Averof, is the only remaining armored battle cruiser of this era and is a museum ship, at Faliro, Greece, near Athens. en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Greek_cruiser_Georgios_Averof
